item.title: Remove .DS_Store files from Git
item.description: Remove .DS_Store files from Git It gets annoying when you see a .DS_Store file in every single directory after you push to a git repository. Luckily, we can use .gitignore to ignore them when you commit your changes. I found a pretty good solution on Stack Overflow: Remove existing files from the repository: find . -name .DS_Store -print0 | xargs -0 git rm -f --ignore-unmatch Add the line .DS_Store to the file .
